http.title: Marietta, GA | Official Website
http.html:
Skip to Main Content

  1. How Do I...
  2. Visitors
  3. Services
  4. Business
  5. City Hall


  1. Marietta Arts Council Announces 2019 Mountain to River Trailfest

    The Marietta Arts Council will present its second annual arts festival, Mountain to River Trailfest, on Saturday, May 11, 2019 from 11:00 am to 7:00 pm along the Mountain to River trail. Read on...

  2. Marietta Tree Keepers to Host Annual Spring Sip n’ Stroll on April 26, 2019

    Marietta Tree Keepers invites you to attend their next Sip n’ Stroll on April 26, 2019. The event features a special casual tour with tree experts, identifying common opportunities and issues relating to trees. It’s free and open to the public. Read on...

  3. City of Marietta Needs Your Input!

    The City of Marietta seeks the community’s input for its Envision Marietta, Livable Centers Initiative Study. Read on...

  4. Evening with History: Historian Alan R. McClarnand

    On Tuesday, April 23rd, at 6:30pm, the Marietta Museum of History will host an Evening with History lecture featuring historian, Alan R. McClarnand. Read on...

  5. Volunteers Needed to Maintain Hill Park

    Marietta Tree Keepers invites volunteers of all ages to help maintain Hill Park on Saturday, April 20 at 8:30am. Tools and refreshments provided. Dress for outdoor weather. Read on...

  6. Marietta Museum of History to Host Pop-In For Family Fun: Sports

    The Marietta Museum of History will be hosting its monthly Pop-In event on Saturday May 18th from 10:30am-3:30pm. Join them in May for Sports themed fun. Read on...

  7. City Offices Closed for Good Friday

    City of Marietta Administrative Offices will be closed Friday, April 19, 2019. The City's sanitation schedule including garbage, brush/yard waste and recycling will change for the week. Read on...

  8. South Park Square to Close for Parking During Week of April 14th for Repaving Project

    The City of Marietta is pleased to announce that the South Park Square sidewalk project is nearing completion just in time for the Taste of Marietta at the end of April. Read on...

  9. MPD Announces Rad Kids Summer Camp

    The Marietta Police Department, Cobb County Police Department and the Cobb County Safety Village are excited to announce the first ever Rad Kids Summer Camp June 10-13, 2019. Read on...

  10. Pop-In at the Marietta Museum of History: Spring Crafts

    The Marietta Museum of History will be hosting its monthly Pop-In event on Saturday, April 20th from 10:30am-3:30pm. Craft tables will be set up throughout the Museum so children and their parents can explore the Museum at their own pace. Read on...

  11. MPD Announces Next Citizens Police Academy will Begin on April 25, 2019

    The Marietta Police Department is pleased to announce its upcoming Citizens Police Academy will begin on April 25, 2019. This program provides citizens an opportunity to experience and take an in-depth look at what it is like to be a police officer. Read on...

  12. MPD Announces Rad Kids Classes in April

    The Marietta Police Department is pleased to announce its next installment of Rad Kids classes beginning April 16, 2019. Rad Kids is a safety education program that emphasizes personal empowerment. Read on...

  13. Marietta Visitors Bureau Announces New Look

    The Marietta Visitors Bureau, the city’s main source for travel information, has completed its brand transformation with a new logo and website. Read on...

  14. Marietta Gone With the Wind Museum to Celebrate 80th Anniversary June 21-23, 2019

    It’s 80 years since the Academy Award-winning movie, “Gone With the Wind,” premiered, yet the 1939 film classic remains one of the most popular movies of all time. From June 21-23 the Marietta Gone With the Wind Museum will celebrate this milestone. Read on...

  15. City of Marietta Announces 43rd Annual May-Retta Daze Festival

    The City of Marietta is pleased to announce the 43rd Annual May-Retta Daze will be held on May 4 & 5, 2019 on the Square. The 2019 Festival features an expansion of exhibitors and artists and a new Music Festival to featuring live musical performances. Read on...

  16. ‘Murder! at The Strand’ Brings New Mystery in 2019

    The creators of 2018’s sell-out success Murder! at The Strand are back with Murder! at The Strand II: Dark Matters, a new interactive inter-dimensional murder mystery that uses the historic building to immerse the audience in a thrilling investigation. Read on...

  17. Georgia Symphony Youth Orchestra Program Expanding

    The Georgia Youth Symphony Orchestra (GYSO) is poised to offer additional opportunities for gifted and talented young musicians, as it expands its program for the 2019-2020 school year. Read on...

  18. Marietta’s Parks & Recreation to Host Breakfast with the Easter Bunny on Saturday, April 20th

    Marietta's Parks & Recreation Department is pleased to announce it will host a special Breakfast with the Easter Bunny on Saturday, April 20, 2019 from 10am – 12pm at the Custer Park Sports and Fitness Center. Read on...

  19. Marietta Parks and Recreation Opens Registration for Kilometer Kids

    The City of Marietta’s Parks and Recreation Department is pleased to announce that registration is now open for Kilometer Kids which will be held at Tumlin Park on Tuesday and Thursdays from April 9 through May 27, 2019 from 6-7pm. Read on...

  20. Strand Announces First Full Theatrical Season

    The Strand Theatre has announced a seven show theatrical season for 2019 that includes the return of the popular Murder! at The Strand franchise, national touring show Little Black Dress, and Ed Asner in his one man show A Man and His Prostate. Read on...

  21. Marietta Police Athletic League Announces Summer Camp Registration Now Available

    The Marietta Police Athletic League (PAL) is pleased to announce registration is now open for their summer camp offered for children in first through eleventh grade. Registration is open now through Thursday, March 28, 2019. Read on...

  22. Registration Open for Custer Park Sports & Fitness Center’s Start Smart Program

    Custer Park Sports and Fitness Center is pleased to offer another installment of the Start Smart Program beginning on Saturday, April 13, 2019. The program will run every Saturday from April 13 – May 18 from 11:00am – 12:00pm. Read on...

  23. City of Marietta Offers Alexa and Google Assistant to Better Serve its Citizens

    The City is pleased to announce it has added yet another helpful feature in its quest towards becoming a well-rounded “SMART” city. The City is now pleased to offer Google Assistant and Alexa to better answer your questions. Read on...

  24. Download Marietta’s TravelSafely App Today at Google Play or iTunes Store!

    The City of Marietta is pleased to announce its Marietta TravelSafely app that is available for download immediately at both the Google Play and iTunes Store. To download now, visit either store and search for “Glance TravelSafely.” Read on...

  25. Marietta Police Department Reminds Citizens to LOCK, TAKE, HIDE

    The Marietta Police Department would like to remind citizens that thefts from autos are on the rise, not only in Marietta, but throughout the region. Read on...

  26. Frequently Asked Questions Regarding Online Permitting Process

    The City of Marietta has been successfully processing permit applications via the website for a few months, but we have noticed a few frequently asked questions. Read on...
/CivicAlerts.aspx



  1. Marietta Parks and Recreation Announces Glover Park Concert Series Schedule

    The City of Marietta's Parks and Recreation Department is pleased to announce the 2019 Glover Park Series schedule! Read on...

  2. City of Marietta Announces 43rd Annual May-Retta Daze Festival

    The City of Marietta is pleased to announce the 43rd Annual May-Retta Daze will be held on May 4 & 5, 2019 on the Square. The 2019 Festival features an expansion of exhibitors and artists and a new Music Festival to featuring live musical performances. Read on...

  3. City of Marietta Releases New FREE “Trash Talk” App

    The City of Marietta is pleased to release a new citizen friendly sanitation app called “Trash Talk” to better aide your trash and recycling needs! Read on...

  4. Marietta Fire Department Offers FREE Seatbelt Safety Check

    The Marietta Fire Department is pleased to announce they will now offer FREE seatbelt safety checks to the residents of the City. Read on...
